example: The new policy will involve significant changes to our operations. / 新しいポリシーは、我々の運営に大きな変化を伴う。

definition_en: To roll or fold up; to wind round; to entwine.
example: The company was involved in the project, but the CEO didn't know the details. / コンパニーはプロジェクトに関与していたが、CEOは詳細を知らない。

definition_en: The action or an instance of flowing or coming out, an outflow, particularly:
meanings_ja: 嗜好・関心（個人的な嗜好や関心）
example: The company faced many issues in its new marketing campaign. / その会社、新しいマーケティングキャンペーンで多くの問題に直面した。

definition_en: To connect or combine into one; to put together.
example: The company will be joining the competition in a few months. / 社会は数ヶ月後に競争に参加する。

definition_en: An organ in the body that filters the blood, producing urine.
meanings_ja: (insulting term) - this is not a common or recommended translation, but it's worth noting that "kidney" can be used as an informal or sarcastic way to refer to someone who is weak or vulnerable. However, please avoid using this translation in most cases!
example: The doctor examined my kidney to check for any damage. / 尾茎を検査して傷害の有無を確認した。

definition_en: A laboratory.
example: The new lab equipment will help us solve this problem. / 新しい研究室設備が私たちはこの問題を解決するのに役立ちます。

definition_en: A small ticket or sign giving information about something to which it is attached or intended to be attached.
meanings_ja: 印刷された名前、ラベル
example: The company attaches labels to its products. / その会社は商品にラベルを貼り付ける。

definition_en: The movement of a vessel from land into the water; especially, the sliding on ways from the stocks on which it is built. (Compare: to splash a ship.)
example: NASA is going to launch a new spacecraft tomorrow. / NASAは明日、新しい宇宙船を発射します。

definition_en: To throw (a projectile such as a lance, dart or ball); to hurl; to propel with force.
meanings_ja: 市場に商品を投入した
example: We launched a new product last month. / 我々は最近月に新製品を発売しました。

definition_en: A single thickness of some material covering a surface.
example: The new software has several layers to ensure security. / 新しいソフトウェアには複数の層があり、セキュリティを確保しています。

definition_en: A single thickness of some material covering a surface.
example: The company has a multi-layered management structure. / その会社には多くの層を持つマネジメント構造があります。

definition_en: To cover, fill, or affect with lead
example: The leading researcher in the field is making groundbreaking discoveries. / この分野の指導的研究者が新しい発見をしている。

definition_en: A heavy, pliable, inelastic metal element, having a bright, bluish color, but easily tarnished; both malleable and ductile, though with little tenacity. It is easily fusible, forms alloys with other metals, and is an ingredient of solder and type metal. Atomic number 82, symbol Pb (from Latin plumbum).
meanings_ja: 引用物を与える (in sports, music, etc.)
指導・指揮する (in business, politics, etc.)
example: The new leads on the project will be revealed tomorrow. / プロジェクトの新しい 順序は明日発表します。

definition_en: To allow to, not to prevent (+ infinitive, but usually without to).
example: I'm letting my kids decide what to do today. / きょうは子供たちに何をして欲しいと決めることにしている。

definition_en: Something or somebody considered likely.
example: The weather is likely to be sunny tomorrow. / 明日は晴れそうです。

definition_en: To restrict; not to allow to go beyond a certain bound, to set boundaries.
example: The company has a limited number of employees. / その会社は従業員が少ないです。

definition_en: A restriction; a bound beyond which one may not go.
example: The company has set strict limits on employee salaries. / 会社は従業員の給与に厳しい限界を設定しています。

definition_en: Some text or a graphic in an electronic document that can be activated to display another document or trigger an action.
example: The link between the two cities is a highway. / その二つの都市間の関連は高速道路です。

definition_en: Some text or a graphic in an electronic document that can be activated to display another document or trigger an action.
meanings_ja: 関連情報 (in a digital context)
example: The company's website has links to their social media accounts. / そのウェブサイトには社長のSNSアカウントへのリンクがあります。

definition_en: Word for word; not figuratively; not as an idiom or metaphor
example: I'm literally starving! / 私は実際に腹が空いている!

definition_en: Lines
example: The song has an ll in its title. / タイトルに ll がある歌があります。

definition_en: A visual symbol or emblem that acts as a trademark or a means of identification of a company or organization.
meanings_ja: ブランドマーク、識別マーク
example: The new logo of our company was unveiled today. / 我々の会社の新しいロゴが今日発表されました。

definition_en: To cause (something) to cease to be in one's possession or capability due to unfortunate or unknown circumstances, events or reasons.
example: I'm feeling like I'm losing my confidence. / 私は自信が落ち込んでいます。

definition_en: The result of no longer possessing an object, a function, or a characteristic due to external causes or misplacement.
example: The company suffered a loss due to the economic downturn. / その企業は経済的低迷による失格を受けた。

definition_en: (physical) Matter, material.
meanings_ja: 大量、集まり (in a social or economic sense)
example: The mass media is having a significant impact on our society. / マスメディアは私たちの社会に大きな影響を与えています。

definition_en: Of or relating to the mind or an intellectual process.
example: The mental health of the students was a concern. / 学生たちの精神衛生が問題になっていた。

definition_en: In a mental manner; an idea thought out in one's mind, as opposed to an idea spoken orally.
example: She's mentally preparing herself for the big exam. / 彼女は大きな試験に対する準備を頭の内側において行っている。

definition_en: Alternative form of mike
example: Can you turn up the mic on my guitar? / ギターのマイクを上げてくれませんか?

definition_en: The ability for rational thought.
example: The company wants to reach young minds with its new advertising campaign. / 会社は若い世代の考え方に新しい広告キャンペーンを通じてアピールすることを目指しています。

definition_en: To stir together.
meanings_ja: 似た物を混ぜ合わせた
混じった、複雑な状態の
example: The salad was mixed with tomatoes and lettuce. / サラダはトマトとレタスと混合された。
I need 5 ml of medicine. / 私は5ミリリットルの薬を必要です。

definition_en: An expression used to show contentment for something
meanings_ja: ミリメートル (物理の単位)
example: The diameter of the ball is 10 mm. / ボールの直径は10ミリメーターです。

definition_en: A publication that is published once a month.
example: I receive a monthly newsletter. / 私は月刊ニュースレターを受信します。

definition_en: A state of progression from one place to another.
meanings_ja: 論旨、提案 (in a formal or official context, e.g. in politics or business)
example: The company made a motion to increase salaries. / 会社は給与の増額を提案した。

definition_en: A machine or device that converts other energy forms into mechanical energy, or imparts motion.
meanings_ja: モーターのように働く (in a mechanical or figurative sense)
example: The car's motor is powerful. / この車の電動機は力強い。

definition_en: Physical motion between points in space.
example: The movement of the crowd was impressive. / その群集の動きは印象的でした。

definition_en: Physical motion between points in space.
meanings_ja: 音楽のパフォーマンス
example: The company's new product has been met with significant movements in the stock market. / その新製品は株式市場で大きな動きをみせた。

definition_en: A contractile form of tissue which animals use to effect movement.
meanings_ja: 힘の源、力の基盤 (this refers to the physiological meaning of muscles as the source of physical strength)
example: The gym helped me build strong muscles. / ゴールドジムでのトレーニングで強い筋肉を構築した。

definition_en: Inevitably; of necessity.
example: I had to go to work necessarily. / 僕は仕事に行く必要があった。

definition_en: A fine, sharp implement usually for piercing such as sewing, or knitting, acupuncture, tattooing, body piercing, medical injections, etc.
example: I need to sew this torn fabric with a needle and thread. / これを縫うために針と糸が必要です。

definition_en: Refusal or withholding of assents; prohibition, veto
meanings_ja: ナガティブの (referring to a musical note)
example: The test result was negative. / テスト結果は否定的な。

definition_en: A bundle of neurons with their connective tissue sheaths, blood vessels and lymphatics.
example: The candidate's nerve failed him during the interview. / 設備の弱点は、システムを不安定にした。
I got a great deal online through a discount net. / インターネットを通じて大きな割引のネットで偉い取引をした。

meanings_ja: オンラインビデオ配信サービス
example: I'm currently binge-watching Netflix. / 私は現在Netflixでバッチワールド中です。

definition_en: To no extent, in no way.
meanings_ja: ない (not existent) (in a mathematical or logical sense)
example: I don't like non-vegan food. / 私は非 veggieフードが好きじゃない。

definition_en: Easily discovered, seen, or understood; self-explanatory.
example: It's obvious that she's not happy. / 彼女は明らかに不幸ですね。

definition_en: In an obvious or clearly apparent manner.
meanings_ja: ありふれたにすぎない (less common, but still possible)
example: She's obviously the best candidate for the job. / 彼女は当然最適な候補者です。

definition_en: (of a function) Assuming each of the values in its codomain; having its range equal to its codomain.
example: I placed the book onto the table. / 表umaticに本を置きました。

definition_en: In an open manner, visibly, not covertly.
example: She spoke openly about her feelings. / 彼女は自分の感情について公然に話した。

definition_en: To perform a work or labour; to exert power or strength, physical or mechanical; to act.
example: We will operate the new machine tomorrow. / 明日、新しい機械を運用します。

definition_en: To perform a work or labour; to exert power or strength, physical or mechanical; to act.
meanings_ja: 操作中 (in a technical or mechanical sense)
example: The company is operating on a global scale. / 会社は全球的に運営しています。

definition_en: One who operates.
example: The operator of this machine is experienced. / この機械の係り人は経験がある。

definition_en: A chance for advancement, progress or profit.
example: "This job provides many opportunities for professional growth." / 「この仕事にはプロフェッショナルな成長の機会が多くあります。」

definition_en: Arrangement, disposition, or sequence.
example: I placed an order for a new smartphone. / 新スマートフォンを注文しました。

definition_en: A larger part of an organism, composed of tissues that perform similar functions.
example: The church has a beautiful organ. / 教会には美しい音楽器具があります。

definition_en: (often preceded by "the") The environment outside of enclosed structures.
example: I love spending time outdoors. / 私は自然の外部に過ごすのを愛します。

definition_en: Two similar or identical things taken together; often followed by of.
example: I like to wear matching pairs of shoes. / 私は同じ色の靴を着けます。

definition_en: A small individual part of something larger; a detail, a point.
example: "What are the particular steps to get there?" / "何が特定の手順なのか?"

definition_en: To change place.
example: The train was passing through the station. /列車は駅を通り過ぎた。

definition_en: Model, example.
example: The fashion designer created a new collection of clothing with unique patterns. /ashion daizainā wa aratana serekitto ni moji no patorunu o tsukurimashita.

definition_en: To do something; to execute.
meanings_ja: 舞台で演じた (in a theatrical context)
example: The band performed a concert in Tokyo. / 東京でコンサートを実行しました。

definition_en: An advertisement by which individuals attempt to meet others with similar interests.
example: I keep my personal problems to myself. / 私の個人的な問題は自分自身に聞かせる。

definition_en: Physical examination.
example: The physical therapy helped her recover from the injury. / その身体療法は彼女が傷害から回復するのを助けました。

definition_en: In a physical manner.
example: I'm not feeling well physically today. / 今日は体調が悪くて具合ない。

definition_en: A medicine or drug, especially a cathartic or purgative.
example: I'm studying physics in college. / 大学で物理学を勉強しています。

definition_en: To grasp and pull with the fingers or fingernails.
example: I'm picking some berries for my salad. / 私はサラダのためになす berries を選ぶ。

definition_en: To put (an object or person) in a specific location.
example: I need to start placing these files on the server. / サーバーにこれらのファイルを配置する必要があります。

definition_en: To design (a building, machine, etc.).
example: The company needs to do some planning for its future projects. / その会社は将来のプロジェクトに対する計画を立てる必要があります。

definition_en: A raised stage from which speeches are made and on which musical and other performances are made.
meanings_ja: 駅構内 (in the context of a train station or similar)
example: The company is building its platform to expand globally. / コマニーは、世界的に拡大するため基盤を建築中です。

definition_en: (authorship) The course of a story, comprising a series of incidents which are gradually unfolded, sometimes by unexpected means.
meanings_ja: 宣伝的な計画 (in a context such as marketing or advertising)
example: The movie's plot was too predictable. / 映画の物語は予測できた。

definition_en: A pronged connecting device which fits into a mating socket, especially an electrical one.
meanings_ja: (音楽での)曲の途中への繋ぎ
example: The lamp needs a plug to work. / ランプは電源を供給するプラグが必要です。

definition_en: A positive quantity.
example: I'll add a plus to your score. / あなたのスコアにプラスを加えます。

definition_en: The people living within a political or geographical boundary.
meanings_ja: 住民、住人 (depending on the context, this can refer to the number of people living in a specific area or the actual individuals making up that population)
example: The population of Tokyo is over 13 million. / 東京の人口は1300万人以上です。

definition_en: The quality of being possible.
example: There is a possibility that it will rain tomorrow. / 明日雨が降る可能性がある。

definition_en: Currently unrealized ability (with the most common adposition being to)
meanings_ja: 可能性 (for abstract or future potential), 能力 (for innate or acquired potential)
example: This student has great potential to become a top athlete. / この生徒は優秀なアスリートに成り得る大きな可能性を持つ。

definition_en: To be in the habit of choosing something rather than something else; to favor; to like better.
example: The company prefers to hire candidates with experience. / その会社は経験者をhireすることを好ましいと考えている。

definition_en: The act of presenting, or something presented
meanings_ja: 表示会 (particularly in a business or academic context)
example: I'm preparing a presentation on new marketing strategies. / 新しいマーケティング戦略についてのプレゼンテーションを作成しています。

definition_en: An existing criminal record (short for "previous convictions")
example: I've read all the previous books in the series. / そのシリーズ全作品を読み尽くしました。

definition_en: (with present-tense constructions) First; beforehand, in advance.
meanings_ja: そのままであった、かつての状態であった
example: I was previously a student. / 私は学生としていた。

definition_en: An advantage of something, especially when contrasted with its disadvantages (cons).
example: He's a pro at winning games. / 彼はゲームで勝つことにプロです。

definition_en: To move, pass, or go forward or onward; to advance; to carry on
meanings_ja: 取り組む (in a more formal or official sense)
example: We need to proceed with the project as planned. / 私たちは計画どおりにプロジェクトを続ける必要があります。

definition_en: A series of events which produce a result (the product).
meanings_ja: 処理、プロセス (in scientific or technical contexts)
example: The company went through a rigorous process to develop the new product. / その会社は新製品の開発に向け徹底した手続きを行った。

definition_en: A series of events which produce a result (the product).
meanings_ja: 処理や操作 (複数の意味がある場合は、主要な意味を2-3個まで列挙)
example: The company's processes for managing quality control were outdated. / その会社は品質管理についての方法が古い。

definition_en: Movement or advancement through a series of events, or points in time; development through time.
example: The new policy has made significant progress. / 新しい政策は大きな進歩を果たした。

definition_en: A planned endeavor, usually with a specific goal and accomplished in several steps or stages.
meanings_ja: 導入（Dōryoku） (in a business or academic context)
example: We're working on a project to develop a new product. / 新製品開発プロジェクトに取り組んでいます。

definition_en: To make a living; earn money for necessities.
example: The new policy provides a safer working environment. / 新しい政策はより安全な勤務環境を提供します。

definition_en: To make a living; earn money for necessities.
example: The company is providing financial support to its employees. / その会社は社員に対し財政的な支援を提供しています。

definition_en: To apply a force to (an object) so that it comes toward the person or thing applying the force.
example: The rope was pulling me down into the water. / 水中に向かって引き込まれていた。

definition_en: One who, or that which, is pure.
meanings_ja: こころやかしい、すっきりした
example: The water in this spring is pure. / この泉の水はまずます。

definition_en: An objective to be reached; a target; an aim; a goal.
example: What is the purpose of this project? / このプロジェクトの目的は何ですか？

definition_en: A line or series of mountains, buildings, etc.
example: The range of mountains stretches from north to south. / 山岳が北から南に stretch する範囲がある。

definition_en: (often in the plural) a rough section of a river or stream which is difficult to navigate due to the swift and turbulent motion of the water.
example: The rapid train arrived on time. / 速い電車は正確に到着した。

definition_en: With speed; in a rapid manner.
example: The train is moving rapidly across the country. /列車は国内を速度的に通過しています。

definition_en: A scarce or uncommon item.
example: This species of flower is rare in this region. / この植物はこの地域ではめったに見られない。

definition_en: (sugar refining, sugar trade) An unprocessed sugar; a batch of such.
meanings_ja: 未熟な (in some cases, this translation is used when referring to people's emotions or opinions)
example: The chef only uses raw ingredients in his recipes. / 料理家は生の食材のみを使う。

definition_en: To extend, stretch, or thrust out (for example a limb or object held in the hand).
example: The goal was reaching, but we still had a long way to go. / ゴールは近づいてきたがまだ遠い距離があった。

definition_en: An action or statement in response to a stimulus or other event.
meanings_ja: はたらくこと (physical reaction), かんしゃく (chemical reaction)
example: The fire department's quick reaction saved many lives. / 救急部隊の速いじょうどうで多くの命を救った。

definition_en: An action or statement in response to a stimulus or other event.
example: The company received negative reactions to their new product launch. / その新製品のリリースに対して、会社は否定的な反応を受けた。

definition_en: The state of being actual or real.
example: The movie's depiction of reality was shocking. / その映画の現実描写は驚くべきだった。

definition_en: To make real; to convert from the imaginary or fictitious into reality; to bring into real existence
example: I realized my dream to travel around the world. / 私は世界を回る夢を実感しました。

definition_en: To take, as something that is offered, given, committed, sent, paid, etc.; to accept; to be given something.
example: I'll send you the package, and then you can start receiving it. / パッケージを送りますから、受け取るのを始められます。

definition_en: To make a record of information.
meanings_ja: 音声や映像を保存した
記録に残した、歴史的な事実など
example: The concert was recorded live. / コンサートはライブで録音された。

definition_en: To make a record of information.
meanings_ja: 音楽録音 (音楽の録音に関する意味)
example: I'll send you a recording of my new song. / ぼくの新曲の音声をあなたに送ります。

definition_en: To bring down the size, quantity, quality, value or intensity of something; to diminish, to lower.
example: The company will reduce its carbon footprint by 50% by using solar power. /企業は、太陽光を使用して50％の炭素フットプリントを小さくする。

definition_en: Any considerable and connected part of a space or surface; specifically, a tract of land or sea of considerable but indefinite extent; a country; a district; in a broad sense, a place without special reference to location or extent but viewed as an entity for geographical, social or cultural reasons.
example: The company operates in several regions. / その会社は複数の地域で営業を行う。

definition_en: Any considerable and connected part of a space or surface; specifically, a tract of land or sea of considerable but indefinite extent; a country; a district; in a broad sense, a place without special reference to location or extent but viewed as an entity for geographical, social or cultural reasons.
example: The company operates in several regions around the world. / その会社は世界中のいくつかの地域で営業している。

definition_en: Something or someone reliable or dependable
example: This company is reliable, so I trust their products. / その会社は信頼できるため、私たちは彼らの製品を信頼しています。

definition_en: Worthy of being remarked or noted; notable
meanings_ja: Exceptional quality or talent (複数ある場合)
example: The new movie was remarkable for its special effects. / 新映画は特別な特殊効果でとても素晴らしいです。

definition_en: An element of broadcast programming originating away from the station's or show's control room.
example: The remote control is not working. / 遠隔コントロールは動作しません。

definition_en: Done several times or in repetition.
meanings_ja: 再び繰り返す (再び繰り返すはより強い再現の意)
example: The company repeatedly asked for a meeting with the CEO. / その会社はCEOとの会議を何度も要請した。

definition_en: To restore to a former place, position, condition, etc.; to put back
example: The company is replacing all outdated equipment with new ones. / 会社は古い機器を新しいものに置き換える。

definition_en: To present again or anew; to present by means of something standing in the place of; to exhibit the counterpart or image of; to typify.
meanings_ja: 表現した (in a artistic or creative sense)
example: The company was represented by a lawyer in court. / 会社は弁護士に代理された。

definition_en: To present again or anew; to present by means of something standing in the place of; to exhibit the counterpart or image of; to typify.
meanings_ja:
I'd be happy to help you with that!

**代表**

* 表示: [hyōji]
* 概ねる: [saikin suru]

例文: The company's logo represents the brand's values. / コーポレーションのロゴはブランドの価値を表す。

Note: The main meanings of "represents" are to indicate or symbolize something, and to give a general idea or overview of something.
example: The company's logo represents the brand's values. / コーポレーションのロゴはブランドの価値を表す。

definition_en: A necessity or prerequisite; something required or obligatory. Its adpositions are generally of in relation to who or what has given it, on in relation to whom or what it is given to, and for in relation to what is required.
example: The company has strict requirements for new employees. / 会社は新入社員に対する厳しい条件を持つ。

definition_en: To ask (someone) for something; to request.
example: This software requires a high-performance CPU to run smoothly. / このソフトウェアは高速CPUが必要です。

definition_en: The act of recovering data or a system from a backup.
example: The company will restore the factory to its original condition. / 会社は工場を元の状態に戻す予定です。

definition_en: To look at again, to reflect on.
example: The company revised its marketing strategy. / 会社はマーケティング戦略を改訂した。

definition_en: Wealthy: having a lot of money and possessions.
meanings_ja: 心地的に裕福 (note that this second meaning implies a more abstract or metaphorical sense of richness)
example: The company became richer after they went public. / その会社は上場後、財務状況が改善された。

definition_en: A possible adverse event or outcome
meanings_ja: 手際の問題 (in a business or financial sense)
example: The company took on too much risk by investing in a new market. / その会社、新しい市場に投資するため、過剰な危険を冒した。

definition_en: A machine built to carry out some complex task or group of tasks by physically moving, especially one which can be programmed.
meanings_ja: ロボットの機能を実現する機械
example: The new robot can assemble cars efficiently. / 新しいロボットは自動車を効率的に組み立てる。

definition_en: A machine built to carry out some complex task or group of tasks by physically moving, especially one which can be programmed.
example: The company is developing robots to assist humans. / 会社は人間を助けるため、造形物を開発しています。

definition_en: In a rough manner; without kindness, softness, or gentleness.
example: The new policy will be implemented roughly within the next three months. / 新しいポリシーは、約3ヶ月以内に実施されます。

definition_en: In a safe manner; without risk; using caution above all else.
meanings_ja: 無事、平安に (in a state of being free from danger or harm)
example: The company's new safety protocols allowed employees to work safely. / その会社の新しい安全規程により、従業員たちは無事に仕事を始めることができた。

definition_en: A part or snippet of something taken or presented for inspection, or shown as evidence of the quality of the whole; a specimen.
example: This company will send us a sample of their new product. / その会社は、新製品の標本を送らせてくれます。

definition_en: A ladder; a series of steps; a means of ascending.
example: The company is downsizing its scale of operations. / 会社は営業の規模を縮小しています。

definition_en: Close investigation.
example: I need to scan this document. / この文書をスキャンしたいです。

definition_en: The location of an event that attracts attention.
meanings_ja: シーン（映画、舞台などでのシチュエーション）
example: The movie features dramatic scenes of war. /映画には戦争のドラマティックなシーンが含まれる。

definition_en: A disruption, mark or shallow cut on a surface made by scratching.
example: I need to scratch my cat behind the ears. /猫の耳後ろを掴く必要があります。

definition_en: To make something (such as an object or message) go from one place to another.
meanings_ja: 配送 (for physical goods), 提出 (for proposals or ideas)
example: I'm sending an email to ask for your opinion. / 私は、あなたの意見を尋ねるためにメールを送信しています。

definition_en: An informal gathering of musicians to play music, especially improvised jazz or a similar genre.
meanings_ja: セッション（音楽や講義など）
example: The conference will have several sessions to discuss the new project. / この会議には新プロジェクトについて多くのセッションがあります。

definition_en: To give part of what one has to somebody else to use or consume.
example: The company's profits were shared equally among all employees. / その会社の利益は全員に分かち合って配られた。

definition_en: To give part of what one has to somebody else to use or consume.
meanings_ja: 共有する (to share knowledge or resources)
分担する (to share tasks or responsibilities)
example: I love sharing my toys with friends. / 私は友達と私の玩具を分け合うことが大好きです。

definition_en: To launch a projectile.
meanings_ja: ストリーミング (in context of video or movie streaming)
example: The new shooting star in Hollywood is a talented young actress. / ハリウッドの新しいスターは才能ある若い女優です。

definition_en: A sequence of states representing an encoded message in a communication channel.
example: The company will send a signal to investors when their stock prices rise. / その会社は株価が上昇した際に投資家に合図を送る。

definition_en: A sequence of states representing an encoded message in a communication channel.
example: The company sent signals that it was considering downsizing. / その会社は、縮小を検討しているというシグナルを送信した。

definition_en: To make a mark
meanings_ja: 承認された (in a more formal or official sense)
example: The contract was signed last week. / その契約は昨週に署名された。

definition_en: That which has significance; a sign; a token; a symbol.
example: The new policy will have significant effects on our business. / 私たちのビジネスに大きく影響する。

definition_en: In a silent manner; making no noise.
example: She silently left the room. / 彼女はと Quietly she departed from the room.

definition_en: (manner) In a like style or manner.
example: I like this restaurant, and similarly, my friend loves it. / 私たちはこのレストランを気に入り、また私の友人はそれを愛している。

definition_en: Having or showing skill; skillful.
example: He's a skilled programmer, able to debug complex code efficiently. / 彼はスキルプログラマーで、複雑なコードを効率的にデバッグできる。

definition_en: Exhibiting social ability or cleverness.
meanings_ja: 最優秀の能力 (in terms of intelligence or skill)
example: He's considered the smartest person in his field. / 彼は、その分野で最高の知性を持つと評価される。

definition_en: The sound of a violent impact; a violent striking together.
meanings_ja: 打ち負かす (in a game or competition)
example: The company's financial crisis was smashed by the government's bailout plan. / 政府の救済計画によって会社の財務危機が激しく壊された。

definition_en: Something that is smooth, or that goes smoothly and easily.
example: The road was smooth and easy to drive. / 道はスムーズで乗り易かった。

definition_en: Encoded computer instructions, usually modifiable (unless stored in some form of unalterable memory such as ROM).
meanings_ja: システムソフトウェア
example: The company develops innovative software for smartphones. / スマートフォン向けの新しいプログラムを開発しています。

definition_en: In one way or another; in a way not yet known or explained; by some means
example: I managed to finish the project somehow / 私はなぜかプロジェクトを完了した

definition_en: More or less; a certain quantity or degree; a part, more or less; something.
example: I like her somewhat. / 私は彼女をちょっと好きです。

definition_en: A general type.
example: I need to sort these papers by date. / これらの文書を日付で並び替えなければならない。

definition_en: A round or irregular patch on the surface of a thing having a different color, texture etc. and generally round in shape.
meanings_ja: まだ生息している状態
小さな点状の色変化 (e.g. skin spots)
example: The park ranger found several endangered species in the forest, which were still in their natural habitats, or "spots". / 森林で、自然状態のままのいくつかの絶滅種を公園所員は発見した。

definition_en: A principle or example or measure used for comparison.
example: The company sets a standard for product quality. / その会社は製品の品質を標準化する。

definition_en: An artificial metal produced from iron, harder and more elastic than elemental iron; used figuratively as a symbol of hardness.
example: The new skyscraper is made of steel. / 新しいスカイSCRAPERは鋼材で作られた。

definition_en: An act of stroking (moving one's hand over a surface).
example: The patient suffered a stroke and was hospitalized. / pacient wa shingyō de buraku to ita.

definition_en: A cohesive whole built up of distinct parts.
example: The new company structures will help to increase productivity. / 新しい企業のシステムと組織を整えることで生産性が上昇します。

definition_en: To undergo hardship.
example: The refugees were suffering from poverty and hunger. / 避難者たちは貧困と飢えに苦しんでいた。

definition_en: The act of supplying.
meanings_ja: 需要に応じて提供する
example: The company will supply us with new equipment. / 会社は新しい機械を私たちに提供します。

definition_en: To keep from falling.
meanings_ja: 帰依する (for someone or something)
example: The company is supporting local charities. / 会社は地元のチャリティーを支えている。

definition_en: The overside or up-side of a flat object such as a table, or of a liquid.
example: The surface of the lake was calm. / 湖の表面は静かかった。

definition_en: A procedure involving major incisions to remove, repair, or replace a part of a body.
example: The doctor performed a successful surgery on the patient yesterday. / 昨日、医者は患者に成功した手術を行った。

definition_en: A character or glyph representing an idea, concept or object.
example: The company's symbols of excellence include a blue ribbon and a golden crown. / その企業の優秀性の表彰はブルーリボンとゴールデンクランである。

definition_en: A collection of organized things; a whole composed of relationships among its members.
meanings_ja: システム、ネットワーク
example: The company has implemented a new financial systems to improve efficiency. / 会社は効率を向上させるため、新しい財務システムを実施した。

definition_en: A marked natural ability or skill.
meanings_ja: 才能 (特に芸術的な才能を指す)
example: She has a lot of talent for singing. / 彼女は歌手としての才能がある。

definition_en: Endowed with one or more talents.
meanings_ja: 才能がある人、才能のある者 (in this case, referring to someone with natural ability or skill)
example: She's a talented singer / 彼女は才 năngのある歌手

definition_en: To communicate, usually by means of speech.
example: He's been talks about his new project all day. / 彼はこの日、自分の新しいプロジェクトについて語り続けている。

definition_en: A butt or mark to shoot at, as for practice, or to test the accuracy of a firearm, or the force of a projectile.
example: The company sets its target on increasing sales by 20%. / 会社は、20%の売り上げ増加を目指す。

definition_en: A butt or mark to shoot at, as for practice, or to test the accuracy of a firearm, or the force of a projectile.
example: The company sets targets to increase sales by 10%. / この会社は10%の売り上げアップをねらいに設定しています。

definition_en: A pickup truck with a gun mounted on it.
example: The company has a technical problem with their new product. / その会社は新製品に関する技術的問題があります。

definition_en: The practical aspects of a given art, occupation etc.; formal requirements.
meanings_ja: 技能, 手法 (複数の意味を示す)
example: The company has developed new techniques to improve efficiency. / その会社は効率向上のために新しい方法を開発した。

definition_en: (archaic outside of idioms) To count, reckon, or enumerate.
example: The movie was very telling about the characters' personalities. / 映画はキャラクターの性格を語っている。

definition_en: To challenge.
example: The company is testing a new product. / 会社は新しい製品を試験中です。

definition_en: A long, thin and flexible form of material, generally with a round cross-section, used in sewing, weaving or in the construction of string.
meanings_ja: 主題, テーマ (in computing and programming)
example: The thread of conversation turned to politics. / 政治についての話が始まった。

definition_en: Completely through, right the way through.
example: I worked throughout the year to complete my project. / 私は一年中を通じてプロジェクトを完成させた。

definition_en: The short thick digit of the hand that for humans has the most mobility and can be made to oppose (moved to touch) all of the other fingers.
example: I hurt my thumb while hiking. / 徒歩で指先を傷めた。

definition_en: A unit of weight (mass) equal to 2240 pounds (a long ton) or 2000 pounds (a short ton) or 1000 kilograms (a metric ton).
example: I need to buy a ton of rice for the party. / パーティー用にトンの米が必要です。

definition_en: A mechanical device intended to make a task easier.
meanings_ja: 工具 (for specific tools or equipment)
example: The new software provides a set of tools to help developers create more efficient code. / 新しいソフトウェアは、開発者が効率的にコードを作成するために、ツールのセットを提供します。

definition_en: An amount obtained by the addition of smaller amounts.
example: The total cost of the trip was $100. / 旅の総額は 100 ドルでした。

definition_en: In the direction of.
meanings_ja: 近づいて (in a physical sense)
example: The company is moving towards a more sustainable future. / 会社はより持続可能な未来に向かって動きを変えている。

definition_en: A person with traditional beliefs.
example: The traditional wedding dress is still popular today. / まだ今日も人気のある伝統的な結婚式のドレスです。

definition_en: To practice an ability.
example: The dog has been trained to fetch. / 犬は.fetchすることを学習した。

definition_en: The act of conveying or removing something from one place, person or thing to another.
meanings_ja: 乗り換え (in context of transportation)
example: I need to transfer my money to my friend. / 私の友人に金を手渡したいです。

definition_en: An operation (often an integration) that converts one function into another.
example: The company will transform into a new entity. / 会社は新しい組織に変化します。

definition_en: An opportunity to test something out; a test.
example: The company will go to trial over allegations of unfair competition. / その会社は不当競争の疑惑に対して訴訟に突入する。

definition_en: Anything that is typical, normal, or standard.
example: This restaurant is typical of those in Tokyo. / 東京の飲食店と変わらないこのレストランは。

definition_en: To put text on paper using a typewriter.
example: I'm good at typing. / 私のキーボードでの入力が上手です。

definition_en: An expression used to show contentment for something
example: "What do you think?" Um, I don't know. / 「あなたの意見は何ですか？」「うー、分からない」

definition_en: Not able; lacking a certain ability.
example: I'm unable to attend the meeting today. / 今日の会議には出席できません。

definition_en: To grasp a concept fully and thoroughly, especially (of words, statements, art, etc.) to be aware of the meaning of and (of people) to be aware of the intent of.
example: I gained a deeper understanding of the topic after reading the book. / 私はその本を読むことで、トピックについてより深い考え方を持つようになりました。

definition_en: An unfamiliar person; a stranger.
meanings_ja: 未曾経験の (for unfamiliarity with a particular culture, technology, etc.)
example: I felt unfamiliar with the new software at first. / 初めは新しいソフトウェアに不調和感があった。

definition_en: Happening through bad luck, or because of some unfortunate event.
meanings_ja: 不運なことの発生 (in a negative sense)
example: I had always wanted to visit Paris, unfortunately it was raining the day I went. / パリをvisitしたいと思っていたが、雨でした。

definition_en: A thing without a like; something unequalled or unparallelled.
example: This design is truly unique. / これはとにかく一風変わらないデザインです。

definition_en: Our universe, the sum of everything that exists in the cosmos, including time and space itself.
meanings_ja: 大宇宙 (referring to the observable universe)
example: The universe is vast and mysterious. / 宇宙は広大で謎めいた。

definition_en: An advisement providing more up-to-date information than currently known.
meanings_ja: 改良、修正 (in a broader sense)
example: The software needs to be updated regularly. / ソフトウェアは何度も最新化する必要があります。

definition_en: Being the target of an action.
example: The company will make a decision upon reviewing the proposal. / その提案をレビューした後、会社は決心します。

definition_en: The manner or the amount of using; use.
example: The company's new usage policy has caused controversy. / その会社の新しい使用方法ポリシーは論争を引き起こした。

definition_en: One who uses or makes use of something, a consumer/client or an express or implied licensee (free user) or a trespasser.
example: The software is designed for end-user. / ソフトウェアはエンドユーザー向けにデザインされています。

definition_en: One who uses or makes use of something, a consumer/client or an express or implied licensee (free user) or a trespasser.
meanings_ja: 採用者 (在職者などを指す場合)
example: The company's users include both individuals and businesses. / その会社の利用者には個人や企業も含まれる。

definition_en: A vast space.
example: The vast desert stretched out before us. / 私達は大きな砂漠が目の前にあると感じた。

definition_en: A specific form or variation of something.
meanings_ja: 型式、バージョン (computer software or game)
example: The new version of the software is available now. / 最新のソフトウェア版が現在利用可能です。

definition_en: The sense or ability of sight.
example: I have a vision for a better future. / ぼくの持つ未来のイメージはより良いものである。

definition_en: Any element of something that depends on sight.
example: The film's visual effects were stunning. / この映画の映像効果は驚嘆的でした。

definition_en: (often followed by up) To stop sleeping.
meanings_ja: 意識を持つ (in a figurative sense)
example: I was waking up to the sound of birds chirping. / 鳩の鳴く音に起こりました。

definition_en: Fate; destiny; luck.
meanings_ja: 不思議、異常 (in this case, "not normal" or "unusual")
example: This band's music is really weird. / これらのバンドの音楽はとんでもない。

definition_en: Metal formed into a thin, even thread, now usually by being drawn through a hole in a steel die.
example: The wire was damaged in the accident. / アクシデントで電線が損傷した。

definition_en: The medium of radio communication.
example: The company uses wireless technology to connect its offices. / 会社は支店間で無線技術を使用して接続しています。

definition_en: In the context of which the present document or ruling is made.
example: The package is wrapped within a layer of plastic. / プラasticsに包まれた内側にパッケージがある。

definition_en: Anything exceptionally surprising, unbelievable, outstanding, etc.
example: "That's a great idea, wow!" / 「すげぇアイデアだな！」

definition_en: The complex joint between forearm bones, carpus, and metacarpals where the hand is attached to the arm; the carpus in a narrow sense.
example: I sprained my wrist while skiing. / スキージャンプで手首を捻傷した。

definition_en: A medicine or other agent to assist hearing.
example: The concert hall has excellent acoustic properties. / コンサートホールは優れた音響性を持つ。

definition_en: Clothing and ornamentation.
example: The data was stored in an array of arrays. / データは配列の配列に保存されました。

definition_en: The act or process of converting the controlling of a machine or device to a more automatic system, such as computer or electronic controls.
meanings_ja: 自動制御 (if you want to emphasize the control aspect)
example: The factory implemented automation to increase efficiency. /_factory had implemented automation to increase efficiency._

definition_en: A spontaneous or unposed photograph.
meanings_ja: 公平に、素直に (for being honest and straightforward)
example: The politician's candid speech surprised many people. / 政治家の調子良くした演説には多くの人々が驚いた。

definition_en: A brace, band, or clasp for strengthening or holding things together.
example: I need to clamp this pipe together so it doesn't leak. / これらのパイプを固定し、漏れないようにする必要があります。

definition_en: A medical student's session spent in a real-world nursing environment.
example: The doctor's clinical approach to patient care was impressive. / 医師は、患者に対する診察的なアプローチを示した。

definition_en: To make smaller; to press or squeeze together, or to make something occupy a smaller space or volume.
meanings_ja: 緊張させる (in physics and engineering contexts)
example: The software compresses files to save space. / ソフトウェアはファイルを圧縮して空間を節約します。

definition_en: In a concrete manner, physically, definitely
example: The company's strategy is concretely outlined in the report. / その報告書には企業の戦略が具体的に述べられている。

definition_en: The act or process of condensing or of being condensed
example: The air conditioner reduces condensation on the windows. / エアコンは窓の蒸発を減らす。

definition_en: To concentrate toward the essence by making more close, compact, or dense, thereby decreasing size or volume.
example: The water was condensing on the mirror due to the cold temperature. / 氷の冷たさで鏡面に水滴ができていた。

definition_en: Something that constrains; a restriction.
example: The project was delayed due to financial constraint. / プロジェクトは財政的制限により遅れた。

definition_en: Something that constrains; a restriction.
example: The company's financial constraints forced them to lay off some employees. / 社長の財務制限により、会社は一部の社員を解雇する必要があった。

definition_en: One or more merchant ships sailing in company to the same general destination under the protection of naval vessels.
example: The convoy of ships sailed across the ocean. / その連携輸送の船団は大西洋を横断した。

definition_en: The outer layer of an internal organ or body structure, such as the kidney or the brain.
example: The cortex plays a crucial role in processing sensory information. / 皮質は感覚情報の処理に重要な役割を果たす。

definition_en: A person who is abused, physically or verbally, and returns to the abuser a supplicant.
meanings_ja: ウェブスクローラー (in computing)
example: The robot is a crawler that can move through tight spaces. / ロボットは狭い空間を移動するイクナギです。

meanings_ja: 専門的に設計された (for software or systems)
example: The company customdeveloped a new app for its employees. / その会社は従業員向けの新しいアプリを独自に作成した。

definition_en: In a diligent manner, with appropriate effort, carefully.
example: I will diligently finish this project by tomorrow. / わたしは明日までにこのプロジェクトをじっくり完了します。

definition_en: The terminal through which electric current passes between metallic and nonmetallic parts of an electric circuit
example: The electrodes were used to measure the patient's heart activity. / ポタンクルの電極は、患者の心拍を測定するために使用されました。

definition_en: To lay as in a bed; to lay in surrounding matter; to bed.
meanings_ja: 嵩入する (for technical or computing contexts)
example: The company embedded a tracking device in every product. / その会社は、全製品に追跡装置を内蔵した。

definition_en: The process of making an estimate.
example: The company made estimations about the market demand and decided to increase production. / 会社は市場需要の推測に基づいて生産を増加した。

definition_en: Including every possible element
example: The company conducted an exhaustive search for the best candidate. / その会社は最良の候補者を探すために完全な調査を行った。

definition_en: The tracking of eye movements
example: The researchers used eyetracking to study how people read and comprehend text. / 研究者は、人々がテキストを読み理解する方法を目視追跡で調べた。

definition_en: Causing fear, dread, awe, or discouragement as a result of size, strength, or some other impressive feature; commanding respect; causing wonder or astonishment.
example: The formidable opponent proved to be too strong for us. / あの強敵は私たちにとりすぎていた。

definition_en: Of, or relating to a foundation or foundations
example: The company's foundational values include honesty and integrity. / その会社の基本的の価値観には、誠実性と公平さが含まれる。

definition_en: The ability to perform a task or function; that set of functions that something is able or equipped to perform.
example: The new software's functionality was impressive. / 新しいソフトウェアの機能性は際だった。

definition_en: In a functional manner.
example: The new system is functionally identical to the old one. / 新しいシステムは古い系統と同じように機能しています。

definition_en: A utensil in the shape of an inverted hollow cone terminating in a narrow pipe, for channeling liquids or granular material; typically used when transferring said substances from any container into ones with a significantly smaller opening.
meanings_ja: 途中の縮小形を与える（機械的な意味）
example: The company uses a funnel to pour liquid into small containers. / 会社は液体を小さな容器に注ぐためにフォンネルを使う。

definition_en: The act of merging separate elements, or the result thereof.
example: The company merged with a rival to achieve fusion. / コンパニーはライバルと合体して統合を実現した。

definition_en: To speak in generalities, or in vague terms.
example: The company's policies are generalized to all employees. / 会社のポリシーは全員に適用される。

definition_en: A sharpening stone composed of extra-fine grit used for removing the burr or curl from the blade of a razor or some other edge tool.
example: She spent hours honing her painting skills. / 彼女は何時間も絵画の技術を磨きました。

definition_en: To fix firmly or set securely or deeply.
meanings_ja: インプレントされただしい、器官を移植した
example: The surgeon implanted a pacemaker in the patient's chest. / 外科医は患者さんの胸部にパセメーカーを植物された。

definition_en: Unable to be conceived or imagined; unbelievable.
meanings_ja: 想像できないほど難しい/奇妙
example: "It's inconceivable that they would betray us." / 「彼らが裏切るなんて無理と思われます」

definition_en: To lead by persuasion or influence; incite or prevail upon.
example: The medication was designed to induce a deep sleep. / 薬物は深い眠りを招致するように設計された。

definition_en: Belonging to or part of an organization; internal.
example: The company developed in-house software for its employees. / その会社は従業員向けにインハウスソフトウェアを開発した。

definition_en: The act of inserting, or something inserted.
example: The doctor performed a successful insertion of the pacemaker. / ドクターはパックメーカーのインセツションを成功させた。

definition_en: Immediate cognition without the use of conscious rational processes.
example: She trusted her intuition to make the right decision. / 彼女は自分の直観に頼って正しい決断をした。

definition_en: One who has (especially parapsychological) intuition.
example: The intuitive answer was correct. / 自然な判断は正しい。

definition_en: A mechanical device consisting of a handgrip mounted on a base or pedestal and typically having one or more buttons, used to control an aircraft, computer or other equipment.
example: The pilot grasped the joystick to steer the plane. / パイロットはハンドルを握って飛行機を操縦した。

definition_en: The absolute or relative size, extent or importance of something.
example: The magnitude of the earthquake was devastating. / 地震の大きさは滅ぼしやすかった。

definition_en: A claim to commendation or a reward.
example: The new policy has many merits. / 新しい政策は多くの優秀な点がある。
The company operates at a microlevel, focusing on individual customer needs. / その会社は、小さなスケールで個々の顧客ニーズに焦点を当てる。

definition_en: To grind or otherwise process in a mill or other machine.
example: The company is milling steel to produce car parts. / 会社は自動車部品の製造に鉄を製造しています。

definition_en: Of, or relating to the nerves, neurons or the nervous system.
meanings_ja: ネットワーク的 (additional meaning) In a broader sense, referring to complex networks of interconnected elements that process and transmit information, similar to neural networks in computer science.
example: The neural network was designed to recognize images. / 神経系のネットワークは画像を認識するために設計された。
"Neurolink technology allows humans to interact with computers using only their thoughts." / "ニューロリンク技術は、人間が思考だけでコンピューターとやりとりできることを可能にします。"

definition_en: Dealing with neurology, the study of the brain
example: The doctor specialized in neurological disorders. / 医者は神経系統の障害に専門だった。

definition_en: Perquisite.
example: The company offers its employees great perks, such as flexible working hours and a free gym membership. / その会社は、フレックスワークや無料ジムメンバーなど優秀な特権を従業員に提供しています。

definition_en: To provide an impetus for motion or physical action, to cause to move in a certain direction; to drive forward.
example: The spaceship was propelled into orbit. / 宇宙船は軌道に動かされた。

definition_en: Of, or relating to, psychiatry.
example: The hospital has a psychiatric department to treat patients with mental illnesses. / 医院には精神疾患を治療するための心理医療部門があります。

definition_en: Of or pertaining to regulation.
example: The regulatory agency oversaw the industry's development. / その規制機関が業界の発展を監視した。

definition_en: To insert again.
example: The software engineer had to reinsert the deleted lines of code. / ソフトウェアエンジニアは削除されたコードの再挿入を行う必要があった。

definition_en: To change the size of something whilst maintaining proportion; especially to change a process in order to produce much larger amounts of the final product.
meanings_ja: スケーリング - scalingの基本的な意味は、物やシステムを大きくすること。
評価 - また、評価や評点という意味合いもある。
example: The company is trying to scale its operations globally. / その会社はグローバルにスケールアップを試みています。

definition_en: Having no seams.
meanings_ja: 無断接続の (referring to software or data connections)
example: The company's customer service was seamless, allowing me to quickly resolve my issue. / その会社のカスタマーサービスはすっきりしていて、問題を速く解決できた。

definition_en: To model, replicate, duplicate the behavior, appearance or properties of.
meanings_ja: 仮想的な、模型化された
example: The company simulated a market survey to test new product ideas. / その会社は新しい製品のアイデアをテストするために市場調査を偽装した。

definition_en: In a violin-family instrument, the carved wooden plug which sits in the bottom block of the instrument.
meanings_ja: 痛撃 (in sports, referring to a sudden increase in score or performance)
example: The team's spike in popularity was due to their winning streak. / チームの人気は連勝に因んだ。

definition_en: In a violin-family instrument, the carved wooden plug which sits in the bottom block of the instrument.
example: The musician's guitar had spikes on the strings. / ギターの弦に尖い棒がある。

definition_en: Unable to reproduce (or procreate).
example: The hospital room was sterile to prevent infection. /病院の部屋は無菌状態で感染を防ぐためです。

definition_en: A state of sulking.
meanings_ja: 不満を漏らす (to express discontent)
example: She started to sulk when she didn't get what she wanted. / 彼女は何も得られなかったため嘆息した。

definition_en: To put thread through.
meanings_ja: プロセス中の並列処理
example: The software is designed to handle multiple tasks through threading. / ソフトウェアは、スレッディングを通じて複数のタスクを処理するように設計されている。

definition_en: To walk unsteadily, as a small child does.
example: The toddler was toddling around the playground. / 小の子供は遊び場で歩いてました。

definition_en: To remove from a box.
meanings_ja: 製品を初めて見ること
example: I love watching product reviews, especially the unboxing process. / 私は製品レビュー、特にパッケージ解散の部分が大好きです。

definition_en: To separate (something that is wound up)
meanings_ja: 解説、解除 (in a mechanical or figurative sense)
example: The tape unwound slowly from the spool. / テープはスローにほどけていました。
The company will invest versa the money it saved. / 会社は、保存した金で投資を逆転させる。

definition_en: The state, quality, or condition of being twisted, physically or mentally:
example: The spacecraft entered the planet's atmosphere, warping its metal hull. / 宇宙船は惑星の大気に突入し、金属の舷体を歪める。

definition_en: The length of a single cycle of a wave, as measured by the distance between one peak or trough of a wave and the next; it is often designated in physics as λ, and corresponds to the velocity of the wave divided by its frequency.
example: The radio station broadcasts on various wavelengths. / ラジオ局は多くの電波長で放送しています。

definition_en: A herb (Reseda luteola) related to mignonette, growing in Europe, and to some extent in America, used to make a yellow dye.
example: The mechanic will weld the broken pipe. / メカニックは破れたパイプを接着する。

definition_en: Making active and effective; bringing into a state of activity.
example: The neural network requires multiple activations to learn the pattern. / ネットワークはパターンを学ぶために複数の活性化が必要です。

definition_en: To collect into a mass or heap.
example: The company had amassed a large fortune through successful investments. / 会社は投資が成功していたため、多くの富を集積した。

definition_en: To increase; to make larger or supplement.
meanings_ja: 承認される (in a digital context, e.g. likes or views on social media)
example: The company's online presence is augmenting its reputation as a leading brand. / その会社のオンライン存在は、そのブランドの権威を増加させる。

definition_en: Self-government; freedom to act or function independently.
example: The country values its autonomy in international relations. / 国は国際関係において自治権を大切に思っている。

definition_en: The width, usually measured in hertz, of a frequency band.
example: The new router increased the bandwidth of our network, allowing us to stream movies smoothly. / 新しいルーターでネットワークの帯域が増加し、映画をストリーミングすることができるようになりました。

definition_en: The act or state of declining or sinking.
example: The conductor emphasized the importance of cadence in the orchestra's performance. / オーケストラのパフォーマンスでの音律は、指揮者が強くアピールした。
The calccarine protein helps regulate calcium levels in neurons. / カルシウム輸送蛋白質が神経細胞のカルシウムレベルを調節します。

definition_en: To check or adjust by comparison with a standard.
example: The scientist had to calibrate the equipment before conducting the experiment. / 科学者は実験を行う前に装置をajustageしなければならなかった。

definition_en: The act of calibrating something.
example: The company performed calibration on the measuring instruments to ensure accuracy. / 会社は計測器の精度調整を行い、正確性を保つようにしました。
The doctor inserted a canula into the patient's vein. / 外科医は患者の静脈に鏈子を挿入しました。
The doctor inserted a canula into the patient's arm to administer medication. / 医者は、患者の腕の中にねじ状の器具を挿した。
The collapse of the civilizational order led to a state of chaos. / 文明的秩序の崩壊により、 Chaos状態になった。

meanings_ja: コンピューター NUMERICAL CONTROL（計算機数値制御）
クンプユーティングナンバー・コントロール（自動化技術）
example: The company uses CNC machines to manufacture precision parts. / その会社は精密部品の製造にＣＮＣマシンを使用しています。

definition_en: Of, or relating to concepts or mental conception; existing in the imagination.
example: The artist's conceptual work was an exploration of human emotions. / 芸術家のコンセプチュアルな作品は、人間的情操を探りました。

definition_en: With permission, with consensus, without coercion; allowed without objecting or resisting
example: The couple's decision was consensual. / 両方が同意した決心だった。

meanings_ja: 皮質 (hikushitsusei) - relating to the cerebral cortex
コルチコイドホルモンのこと (kortikoido horumono no koto) - referring to corticosteroids
example: The doctor examined the patient's cortic tissues to diagnose the condition. / 醸師は患者のかおり組織を診察して疾患を診断しました。

definition_en: Pertaining to the outer layer of an internal organ or body structure, such as the kidney or the brain.
example: The neuroscientist studied the cortical regions of the brain. /脳表面の領域を研究した。

definition_en: Someone who couples things together, especially someone whose job it is to couple railway carriages.
example: The new coupler allowed trains to be connected easily. / 新しい接続器で列車が簡単に繋げられました。

definition_en: Someone who couples things together, especially someone whose job it is to couple railway carriages.
meanings_ja: 接続器 (sekku jiki) - A device that connects two things together.
クロスビーム (kurosu bīmu) - In rail transport, couplers refer to devices that connect railroad cars.
example: The new couplers on the train allowed for smoother connections. / 新しい列車の接続器により、滑らかな接続が可能になった。

definition_en: To press into small ridges or folds, to pleat, to corrugate.
example: The engineer designed a system to crimp the wires securely. / エンジニアは強力にワイヤーを接着するシステムを設計した。

meanings_ja: コンピューター制御の
生体系に似たシステムの
example: The new cybernetic system helped optimize the company's efficiency. / 新しいコンピューター制御システムで会社の効率を最適化した。

definition_en: A person who is part machine, a robot who is part organic.
meanings_ja: 人間と機械のハイブリッド
生命体に機械的な要素を組み合わせた存在
example: The cyborg was used to explore the distant planet. / このサイボーグは遠い惑星を探検するために使われた。

definition_en: To make feeble; to weaken.
example: The chronic illness was debilitating, making it hard for her to work. / 長い間の疾患は疲弱させるため、彼女が仕事をやめることが困難だった。

definition_en: Characterized by or causing degeneration.
example: The degenerative disease was caused by a genetic mutation. / Geneticsによる衰退的な病気であった。

definition_en: To remove the mystery from something; to explain or clarify.
example: The new documentary aims to demystify the world of quantum physics, making it accessible to a wider audience. / クォンタム物理の世界を秘密を解明し、より広い層にアクセシブルにする新しいドキュメンタリーが目的である。

definition_en: Skill in performing tasks, especially with the hands.
example: The gymnast's dexterity allowed her to perform a flawless routine. / よきな体操の技巧を持つ彼女は、完璧なプログラムを演出できた。

definition_en: Separate; distinct; individual; non-continuous.
meanings_ja: 小さなまとまりのあるもの
example: The company offers discrete consulting services for each client. / その会社は、各クライアントにあたって独立したコンサルティングサービスを提供しています。

definition_en: The dura mater, the outer covering of the brain and spinal cord.
meanings_ja: 頭蓋骨の硬膜 (mainly refers to anatomy)
example: The doctor examined the patient's dura after the head injury. / 兵士は頭蓋骨の硬膜を検査しました。

definition_en: A failure to regulate properly
meanings_ja: 状態乱れ (in a medical context, referring to a disturbance in bodily functions)
example: The patient's blood sugar levels experienced dysregulation due to the medication. / 薬物の副作用により、患者さんの血糖値が調節異常となった。

definition_en: The terminal through which electric current passes between metallic and nonmetallic parts of an electric circuit
example: The electrode was used to measure the chemical reaction. / 化学反応を測定する電極が使われた。

definition_en: To brighten (a metal) by the electrolytic removal of its surface.
meanings_ja: 金属表面を電気的に研磨すること
example: The company uses electropolishing to improve the surface finish of metal parts. / 金属部品の表面を改善するために、会社は電気的に研磨しています。
The river erosion has affected the surrounding landscape. / 河川の侵食は周囲の地形に影響している。

definition_en: To form into a whole by uniting its parts; to construct; to build.
meanings_ja: 虚構する (for creating a false impression)
example: The company fabricated the results to impress investors. / コンパニーは投資家に印象を与えるため、結果を偽造した。

definition_en: The act of fabricating, framing, or constructing; construction; manufacture
example: The company's claims about its new product were a fabrication. / その会社の新製品についての主張は偽造だった。

definition_en: A crack or opening, as in a rock.
example: The doctor examined the patient's fissure and found it was not serious. / 医者は患者のは 裂口を検査して深刻でないと発見した。

definition_en: The ability to perform a task or function; that set of functions that something is able or equipped to perform.
example: The new software offers additional functionalities to improve user experience. / 新しいソフトウェアは、ユーザーの体験を向上させるための追加の操作機能を提供します。

definition_en: Consisting of, or resembling, granules or grains
meanings_ja: 粉末状の (business or industry context)
example: The company's new policy is granular, providing detailed instructions for each step. / その会社の新しいポリシーは、各段階について詳細な指導を提供している。

definition_en: (chiefly with capital initial) Pertaining to Hermes Trismegistus or the writings attributed to him.
example: The hermetic nature of the ancient text made it difficult to decipher. / 古いテキストの封印的な性質は、読み取ることが困難だった。
The audiophile praised the new speaker system for its highfidelity sound. / 新しいスピーカーは高音質の音を評価した。

definition_en: The act of impeding; that which impedes; a hindrance.
meanings_ja: 阻害率 (electrical circuit) / 懐妄感 (psychological)
example: The impedance of the speaker was high, so it didn't work well with low-quality amplifiers. / スピーカーの抵抗率が高かったため、質の低いアンプと組み合わせるとよく動作しませんでした。

definition_en: A device that can be implanted surgically.
example: The new pacemaker is implantable, so it can be inserted under the skin. / 新しいペースメーカーは植え込めるため、皮下に埋め込むことができます。

definition_en: The way in which an organ, bone, muscle etc. becomes inserted into its set place.
meanings_ja: 妊娠の開始 (specifically referring to the process of fertilization)
example: The team studied the successful implantation of stem cells in the patient. / スチームセルが患者に成功的に埋植されたことを調査した。

definition_en: A function that iterates
example: We need to iterate through the entire dataset to find any errors. / は全体のデータセットを検索するため、繰り返し必要です。

definition_en: Recital or performance a second time; repetition.
example: The algorithm requires multiple iterations to converge. / アルゴリズムは、収束するために何回も繰り返す必要があります。

meanings_ja: 繰り返し的に (in the context of computing or algorithms)
example: The algorithm processes data iteratively to improve accuracy. / アルゴリズムは、精度を向上させるためにデータを繰り返し処理する。
The Leforge family has a long history in France. / フランスにレフォージ氏族は長い歴史を持つ。
The limbic system is involved in emotional processing. / 脳の内側部は、情動の処理に参与する。

definition_en: The process of printing an image by drawing the image with a water-repellent material onto a hard, flat surface (typically metal), then copying the surface by applying water and ink (or the equivalent) to it and pressing another material against it.
meanings_ja: 石版印刷 (this refers to the original technique of lithography)
example: The artist used lithography to create a unique print of her painting. / アーティストは、彼女の絵を特殊な印刷物にした。

definition_en: Of a communication channel, subject to loss of signal strength.
example: The compression algorithm used was lossy, resulting in a lower quality image. / その圧縮アルゴリズムは低解像度で、画像の質が低下した。

meanings_ja: 美しい言语 (in a poetic sense)
example: The song's lyric was so beautiful that it gave me chills. / その歌の歌詞はとても美しく、びっくりした。

definition_en: To make by machinery.

example: The company improved manufacturability to reduce production costs. / その会社は生産性を向上させて生産コストを削減した。

definition_en: To cause to take physical form, or to cause an object to appear.
meanings_ja: 実現される (in a more formal or literary context)
example: The company's plans to materialize in three years. / その会社の3年の計画が現実化する。

definition_en: A measure for something; a means of deriving a quantitative measurement or approximation for otherwise qualitative phenomena (especially used in engineering).
example: We need to track our website's metrics to improve its performance. / ウェブサイトの数値指標を追跡し、そのパフォーマンスを向上させる必要があります。
The scientist used a microraph to capture the tiny details of the cell. / 科学者は細胞の微小な詳細を撮影するためにmicroraphを使用した。

definition_en: To reduce, lessen, or decrease; to make less severe or easier to bear.
example: The new policy aims to mitigate the negative impact of climate change on local communities. / クリメーントの負の影響を地元コミュニティに及ぼす新しい政策が目指す。

definition_en: Consisting of separate modules; especially where each module performs or fulfills some specified function and could be replaced by a similar module for the same function, independently of the other modules.
meanings_ja: モジュール化された、システムや装置
example: The company developed a modular smartphone system. / その会社はモジュール化されたスマートフォンシステムを開発した。

definition_en: Of a body in motion: the tendency of a body to maintain its inertial motion; the product of its mass and velocity.
example: The team gained momentum after scoring the first goal. / チームは先に1点を決め、勢いを増した。

definition_en: Having the appearance of nature or realism; lifelike or realistic.
meanings_ja: 実際的な、自然体験を基盤とした
example: The novel's naturalistic style portrayed the harsh realities of rural life. / countrysideの荒々しい現実を描いた。
The nerling of her Instagram photo got thousands of likes / Instagramの写真をコピーして、千人以上の「いいね」を集めた
The company is nurturing young talent to take over leadership roles. / その会社は若い才能をリーダーシップ役に育てている。

definition_en: Of, or relating to a neuron
meanings_ja: brain nerve related (other meanings may include cellular or molecular biology contexts)
example: The neuronal connections in our brains help us learn and remember. / 我々の脳には、学習や記憶を助ける神経細胞の接続があります。
The patient suffered from chronic neuropathic pain. / 悪く、患者は神経性疼痛に悩まされました。

meanings_ja: 音声に無い (音声学や言語学などで使用される場合は、「音声に無い」というニュアンスが強い)
example: The nonvocal signals were transmitted through the satellite. / 無音の信号は衛星によって送信された。

meanings_ja: くるみを編む（to weave or braid）
仮想的なネットワークの構築（construction of a virtual network）
example: The team spent hours nurling together to create a secure network. / チームは、安全なネットワークを作るために時間をかけてくるみを編むことにした。

meanings_ja: フィードバックの無いシステム
example: The company uses an open-loop system to manage its supply chain. / その会社は供給チェーンを自律的に管理しています。

definition_en: An eye.
meanings_ja: 触媒の (touching or relating to the eye)
光学の (relating to the study of light and vision)
example: The optic nerve carries visual information from the eye to the brain. / 目の神経は眼から脳に視覚情報を伝える。

definition_en: (originally intransitive) To act optimistically or as an optimist.
example: The company optimized its production process to reduce costs. / 会社はコストを削減するために生産プロセスを最適化した。

definition_en: An orthogonal line
meanings_ja: 直交する (数学的意味合い)
example: The two lines are orthogonal, so they do not intersect. / 二つの線は水平直交しているため、交点を持っていない。

definition_en: An omission; something that is left out, missed or forgotten.
example: The company's oversight of quality control led to a major recall. / その会社は品質管理の監視を不手際にしたため、大規模な回収が必要になった。
The company decided to parcelate the large project into smaller tasks / 会社は大きなプロジェクトを小さなタスクに分割した。

definition_en: An artificial replacement for a body part, either internal or external.
example: The doctor fitted me with a prosthesis after my arm was amputated. / 私の腕が切断された後、医師は私は偽物器官を付けました。

definition_en: Being animate again.
example: The movie reanimated the classic characters, bringing them back to life. / 映画はクラシックなキャラクターを新生させ、生き返らせた。

meanings_ja: 再整理された (複数の意味がある場合は主要な意味を2-3個まで列挙)
example: The recondensed text was easier to read. / テキストは再圧縮され読みやすくなった。

definition_en: The outcome of a replication procedure; an exact copy or replica.
meanings_ja: 謄写する (in a scientific or technical context)
example: The company replicated its successful marketing strategy to reach new customers. / その会社は新しい顧客に到達するために自分の成功したマーケティング戦略を再現した。

meanings_ja: 関係のある人物 (person related by blood or marriage)
example: John was the sahedes of his uncle's vast fortune. / ジョンは叔父の膨大な遺産を継承した。
The website is scrollable on mobile devices. / モバイルデバイスでウェブサイトはスクロール可能です。

meanings_ja: [製織の技術者] (depending on the context)
example: The seamen worked tirelessly to repair the damaged ship. / 海員たちは努力して船を修理した。
The new parts improved the serviceability of the old machine. / 新しい部品で古い機械の使用可能な状態が良くなった。

definition_en: What an enzyme acts upon.
meanings_ja: 装置基板 (in chemistry and biology)
example: The new catalyst was added to the substrate to improve its efficiency. / 新しい触媒を基盤に追加して効率を向上させる。

definition_en: The junction between the terminal of a neuron and either another neuron or a muscle or gland cell, over which nerve impulses pass.
example: The brain's synapses were firing rapidly. /brainは神経接続が激しく発火していた。

definition_en: To cause two or more events or actions to happen at exactly the same time or same rate, or in a time-coordinated way.
example: The fireworks were synchronized to music. / 花火は音楽に一致した。

definition_en: A slender wax candle; a small lighted wax candle
meanings_ja: その方向に向かって絞りを加える
example: The candle's wick will taper to nothing in a few hours. / 数時間でろうそくの芯は何も残らない。

definition_en: The capability to communicate directly by psychic means; the sympathetic affection of one mind by the thoughts, feelings, or emotions of another at a distance, without communication through the ordinary channels of sensation.
example: She claims to have telepathic powers. / 彼女は精神力を持つと主張する。

definition_en: To travel, often instantaneously, from one point to another without physically crossing the distance between the two points.
meanings_ja: 物理的に瞬間移動した
インターネット上で情報を移送した (in a virtual sense)
example: The spaceship teleported to a distant planet. / スペースシャトルは遠い惑星に瞬間移動した

definition_en: To work on or shape with tools, e.g., hand-tooled leather.
example: The company is investing in new tooling to improve manufacturing efficiency. / 会社は、新しい製造設備投資により生産効率を向上させるため新しい工具に投資しています。

definition_en: One that blazes a trail to guide others; a pathfinder.
meanings_ja: 社会の改変に先んじた人物
example: Steve Jobs was a trailblazer in the tech industry. / スティーブ・ジョブズは、技術分野で新しい道を作った人物だった。

definition_en: The path an object takes as it moves.
example: The spacecraft followed a trajectory to Mars. / 宇宙船はマーズに向かっての軌道を辿りました。
"The instructions were unambiguous, so I knew exactly what to do." / 「指示は明白で、我がやったことを正しく理解した。」

definition_en: An arched masonry structure supporting and forming a ceiling, whether freestanding or forming part of a larger building.
example: The bank's vaults were secure and impenetrable. / 銀行の建物は安全で破綻不能です。
